Event: Seeking help from the Suicide Prevention Lifeline and hoping for someone to talk to, but getting stuck in a queue and thinking more about one's actions, which actually helped the individual not to pull the trigger.
Post: "I was feeling so lost and alone, like I had no other choice. But then I called the Suicide Prevention Lifeline and got stuck in a queue. And you know what? It actually helped me realize that there were people who cared about me and wanted to listen. I started thinking more about my actions and how they would affect those around me. And in that moment, I knew I didn't want to pull the trigger. I'm so grateful for that call and for the people who took the time to listen to me."
